question: 1) Which of the following statement is correct?
options: js is the Client Side Language.
js is both Server Side and Client Side Language.
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. Node.js is Server Side Language.

question: 2) What does the REPL stand for?
options: REPL stands for "Read Eval Print Loop."
REPL stands for "Research Eval Program Learn."
REPL stands for "Read Earn Point Learn."
REPL stands for "Read Eval Point Loop."
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. REPL stands for "Read Eval Print Loop".

question: 3) Which of the following command is used to start a REPL session?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. We can start REPL simply by running node on shell/console without any argument.

question: 4) In which language is Node.js written?
answer: Answer: E is the correct option. Node.js is a cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment written in JavaScript, C, C++, and CoffeeScript language.

question: 5) Which of the following command is used to install the Node.js express module?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. The $ npm install express command is used to install the Node.js express module.

question: 6) What is Callback?
options: The callback is a technique in which a method calls back the caller method.
The callback is an asynchronous equivalent for a function.
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The callback is an asynchronous equivalent for a function.

question: 7) Which of the following extension is used to save the Node.js files?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. The ".js" extension is used to save the Node.js files.

question: 8) The Node.js modules can be exposed using:
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. The Node.js modules can be exposed using module.exports.

question: 9) Which of the following module is not a built-in node module?
answer: Answer: D is the correct option. The "fsread" is not a built-in node module.

question: 10) Which of the following method of fs module is used to get file information?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The fs.stat(path, callback) method is used to get information about a file.

question: 11) What does the fs module stand for?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The fs module stands for File System.

question: 12) Which of the following method of fs module is used to truncate a file?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. The fs.ftruncate(fd, len, callback) method is used to truncate a file.

question: 13) Which of the following template engines can be used with Node.js?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. Handlebars are the template engines that can be used with Node.js.

question: 14) Which of the following code print the platform of operating system?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The os.platform() returns the operating system platform.

question: 15) Which of the following method is used to return the current working directory of the process?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. The process.cwd() method is used to return the current working directory of the process.

question: 16) Which of the following statement defines Express?
options: Express is an application framework that provides a robust set of features to develop desktop-based applications.
Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features to develop web and mobile applications.
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features to develop web and mobile applications.

question: 17) Which of the following is not a benefit of using modules in Express?
options: It provides a means of dividing up tasks.
It provides a means of reuse of program code.
It provides a means of reducing the size of the program.
It provides a means of testing individual parts of the program.
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. "It provides a means of reducing the size of the program" is not a benefit of modules in Express.

question: 18) What is the best practice to do in your code to improve the performance of your application?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. Using gzip compression is the best practice to do in your code to improve the performance of your application.

question: 19) What is the default scope in the Node.js application?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. Local is the default scope in the Node.js application.

question: 20) Which of the following engine Node in core?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. Node uses the Chrome V8 engine in the core.

question: 21) Which of the following statement is used to execute the code of the sample.js file?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The "node sample.js" statement is used to execute the code of the sample.js file.

question: 22) Which of the following is not a valid language for Node.js?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. Java is not a valid language for Node.js.

question: 23) Which of the following shortcut command is used to kill a process in Node.js?
answer: Answer: D is the correct option. The Ctrl + C command is used to kill a process in Node.js.

question: 24) How many Node object methods are available?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. There are 18 object methods available in Node.

question: 25) What is the main usage of Node.js terminal (REPL)?
options: To specify the preview of the Node.js application.
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The Node.js terminal (REPL) is used for testing Node.js/JavaScript expressions.

question: 26) Which of the following types of applications can be built using Node.js?
answer: Answer: D is the correct option. All of the above types of applications can be built by using Node.js.

question: 27) Which of the following is used to test if two nodes are equal?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. The "isEqualNode()" is used to test if two nodes are equal.

question: 28) Which of the following tool is used to automate the various tasks of the Node.js application?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. GruntJS tool is used to automate the various tasks of the Node.js application.

question: 29) Which of the following areas, Node.js, is not advised to be used?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. It is not advisable to use Node.js for CPU-intensive applications.

question: 30) Which of the following route parameter formats are valid?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option.

question: 31) Which of the following module is required to create a web server?
answer: Answer: D is the correct option. The url module is required to create a web server.

question: 32) Which of the following is the correct syntax to initiate the Node.js File?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. The correct syntax to initiate the Node.js File is node filename.js.

question: 33) Which of the following method is used to compare the placement of two nodes in the DOM hierarchy (document)?
answer: Answer: B is the correct option. The compareDocumentPosition()method compares the placement of two nodes in the DOM hierarchy (document).

question: 34) Which of the following platforms does Node.js support?
answer: Answer: D is the correct option. Node.js is supported on all of the above written operating systems.

question: 35) Which of the following keyword is used to make properties and methods available outside the module file?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. The exports keyword is used to make properties and methods available outside the module file.

question: 36) Which of the following Node.js object property is used to return the node immediately before a node?
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. The previousSibling object property is used to return the node immediately before a node.

question: 37) Which of the following method can append specified content to a file?
answer: Answer: A is the correct option. The fs.appendFile() method is used to append the specified content to a file. If the file does not exist, it creates the file.

question: 38) Which of the following is a GUI-based debugging tool for Node.js?
answer: Answer: D is the correct option. Node Inspector is a GUI-based debugging tool for Node.js.

question: 39) What is the use of underscore variable in REPL session in Node.js?
options: It is used to store the result.
It is used to get the last command used.
It is used to get the last result.
answer: Answer: C is the correct option. In Node.js, the underscore variable in REPL session is used to get the last result.

question: 40) The buffer class is a global class that can be accessed without importing a buffer module.
answer: Answer: True. A is the correct option. A buffer class is a global class that can be accessed in the application without importing a buffer module.

question: 41) Is Node.js multithreaded?
answer: Answer: No. B is the correct option. Node.js is not multithreaded.

question: 42) Is the process a global object and can be accessed from anywhere?
answer: Answer: True. A is the correct option. The process object is a global object and can be accessed from anywhere.

question: 43) Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model. Is it true?
answer: Answer: True. A is the correct option. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model.

question: 44) The net.isIP(input) returns 0 for invalid input. Is it true?
answer: Answer: True. A is the correct option. The net.isIP(input) tests if input is an IP address. It returns 0 for invalid strings, returns 4 for IP version 4 addresses, and returns 6 for IP version 6 addresses.

question: 45) A stream fires finish event when all data has been flushed to the underlying system. Is it true?
answer: Answer: True. A is the correct option.

question: 46) A stream fires data event when there is data available to read. Is it true?
answer: Answer: True. A is the correct option. A stream fires data event when there is data available to read.
